intro: Coelogyne albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a pseudobulb with fleshy leaves and produces striking white to pale yellow flowers with a strong fragrance. The plant thrives in humid, well-lit environments and requires good air circulation. It blooms once or twice a year, typically in spring or early summer. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for both horticultural and conservation purposes.
